Reviews.Title: “a first night nightmare”
Reviews.Author: brendan b
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Attaturk airport where there was supposed to be a pick up driver for us but none appeared. After some time I phoned the hotel and they promised to pay on arrival. However our airport taxi driver couln't find the hotel for an hour at least. When we arrived we were the told the hotel was overbooked and at about 23.30 hours we were shipped off to anothe rhotel where the the traffic noise kept us awake for most of the night. At least four other guests had been sent off like ourselves. We got no compensation or apologies for the ruination of our first night. The next morning we returned but we we place at the fornt of hotel where traffic noise and nearby music was a constant irritant for the next few days. I booked on the basis of reviews I read here at Trip Advisor and I ask that this review shold be placed towards the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but a little stale”
Reviews.Author: Littleringedplover
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit stuffy, but overall fine. Good location right by the tourist sights. The staff are friendly, but one staff member was a bit 'too friendly' and inappropriately kissed us on the cheeks when putting our suitcases in the room, and touched me every time he walked past, making me feel rather uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at first”
Reviews.Author: LondonUKPhil
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Istanbul in 5* hotels I was quite shocked to find myself in what some travel sites have gradwed 2*. On pulling up I thought at first that the taxi driver was stopping for directions, not realising the hotel was next to us. It is situated on a main street and an alleyway. Inside I was not reassured by a small lobby, tired and uninspiring. On being shown to my room I was likewise less than unimpressed by tired furniture, poor wallcoverings and a bathroom that showed signs of poor workmanship. To find my double aspect room had windows overlooking the main road with lots of trams and traffic whilst the second aspect opened directly behind the outside bar, and I really mean the windows opened onto the area behind the bar, I could reach out my hand and get a beer if I wanted one, you could imagine how I felt having spent the last 18 hours travelling. However the restaurant/brakfast room was lovely, even though the breakfast was less than inspiringly presented. The quality of the breakfast was fine. The hotel staff were all excellent, working hard to make you welcome and feel your custom was valued, with no eye to tips etc. The location is fabulous for all of the main attractions of Istanbul (Sultanahmet area) meaning a stay of 3-4 days is all that is required. I found my initial concerns about the hotel fading away as the days passed and realised that actually it was clean, comfortable and run by people who wanted to make your stay a happy one. As my wife was joining me after 2 nights I moved out to a previous reservation paying twice the rate that I had been paying in the BW Sophia. The hotel, whilst lovely, was within 300 metres and had a smaller room. I hope this is not considered too negative a review because in all honesty if I was told I was staying there again on business I would be quite content.

Reviews.Title: “Practical position, however rather noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Rossotraveller
Reviews.Content: People working at the Saint Sophia are very kind. However the Green Corner open air restaurant, just below the hotel windows, is very noisy: it closes about 11 or 12pm, but people keep cleaning it for the entire night. The sheets were clean but very old, with holes in them and the cleaning service not that good. Besides, to join the hotel with your luggage and a taxi is not that easy: not all taxi want to drive you there. But once you're in, the position is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff and best service!”
Reviews.Author: catchemNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to attractions in the ancient city. Beautiful continental breakfast. Excellent food, consistently. But what is exceptional about this hotel is the staff. Very friendly, very helpful all the time. They go above and beyond. The hotel itself is good value, but it is truly the staff who make this exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: sepideh99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Saint Sophia for a total of 4 nights, 2 nights on our way to Israel and 2 nights on our way back (May 20-22, and June 2-4, 2011) and had an excellent experience both times. The location of the hotel can't be beat. It is within walking distance of the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, and Topkapi Palace. No need to pay for over priced taxis to get around. The hotel staff are friendly and accommodating. The breakfast is wonderful and fresh. We loved the boutique style, small hotel atmosphere and would recommend the hotel to anyone. Definitely would go back to Saint Sophia on future trips to Istanbul. Magical experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible room and staff”
Reviews.Author: UKIan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is virtually adjacent to Hagia Sofia which is fab. The Hotel is falling apart. The staff arent very friendly and once they realised I was only there for one night stopped trying to flog me over priced excursions. The room was in the loft, low roof (I am 6ft3). Floor fell away and wallpaper was hanging of walls. The much advertised 1000 TV channels didnt exist, max 200 if that. I would avoid if possible, there are plenty of other hotels in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: carol23275
Reviews.Content: St. Sophia hotel has a great location, across the street from Aya Sophia, within easy walkiing distance of Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, and many delightful small restaurants. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts in a lovely patio are great. Although the rooms are not fancy, they are very clean and everything works. It was so nice to stay in a small, locally run hotel rather than a large chain hotel. They even provide a (free) transfer from the airport to the hotel on our arrival -- a real plus! We'll definitely stay there again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: rubinaikram
Reviews.Content: great central location right behind ayasophia and 10 min walk to blue mosqe and topkapi. 5 min to cisterns and 20 min to grand bazaar. very friendly staff. reasonable breakfast. however shoul have an in house restaurant. also room cleaning needs to be improved. otherwise hotel very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But That's about It”
Reviews.Author: Norman_Trika
Reviews.Content: Made reservation on Best Western website and stayed only for one night while in transit on a business trip in Istanbul. The hotel is in a super location with many famous sites, tourist shops, restaurants and the tram within easy walking distance. Apart from the location, the room was extremely dimly lit, the A/C was not working properly, the bathroom had a very musty smell, and carpets very dirty. This hotel is not up to the standards that one would expect at a Best Western. For one night, it was liveable, but that's about it. Would not return here if back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great Staff, Location, Cozy Rooms,we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: NancyK60745
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, next to Hagia Sophia--we could see the Blue Mosque from our room. Breakfast had lots of fresh vegetables, yogurt, pastry, cold cuts, etc. and a man who will make you a splendid omlet! Room was of good size, with an excellent bathroom. Although our room was on the main street, with the tramway running outside, it was generally very quiet -- venue across the street plays Turkish music, but this stops @ 10 pm. The terrace pub on the first floor of the hotel is a wonderful place to have a drink and people watch. The staff at the hotel was most helpful and made our 12-day stay a time to remember. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location-Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DubaiMarc
Reviews.Content: Place had a good location, very very standard,, no luxury at all. same breakfast for the 4 days we were there. courteous staff, very warm, helpful Manager. If you book directly u can get some good discounts. This is the season .. go for it.. and stay here.. u can walk to most of the places, tram close by, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia all nearby. We loved the hustle and bustle of the street-not bad..so go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Only location is great!”
Reviews.Author: bazik_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in November 2010. The location is really greate! We stayed at suites with St.Sophia view. The hotel arranged free transfer for us from Ataturk airport. The suites was big enough. But the hotel needs repair! For breakfsat they serve oamlet, tomatoes, cheese, cofee..The tram station is 10min walk from the hotel. The exachange office is right round the coner.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION,LOCATION,LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: makomez
Reviews.Content: i loved best western saint sophia!!!so did all my family:) its one of the best hotels i ever stayed in my whole life we stayed there 1st week of april....it was amazing...the staff are very helpful,and breakfast was good.and what a location!!saint sophia museum is litrellay across the street ,facing blue mosque, topkapi palace 3 min away and near many good restaurants! my parents are going back to istanbul in 6 month and definitly staying in saint sophia! i recommend anyone to stay there:) special thanks to ms. Tula

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Kamilla2
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. It is small hotel with friedly staff. Very Cosy and Lovely Hotel! I was in Istanbul first time and for 4 days. Staff was extremely helpful, whenever I called for anything. the staff was very professional. Best location, in the centre of city. Most of sightseeing you can reach by walk.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy little hotel overlooking Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: GoraDelhi
Reviews.Content: A small comfortable hotel very well located in the Sultanahmet overlooking both Saint Sophia and Blue Mosque. Rooms are large and all amenities including free wi-fi is available. Found the staff very freindly.It was surprising to find no other bread (e.g.English bread for toast) but loaf ( type of french 'pain') was available for breakfast. Secondly it may be wise to decide in advance the currency for settlement. This is true for Istanbul and my advice will be to ask for Turkish Lira tariif for all activities.

Reviews.Title: “we would go back there in an instant!”
Reviews.Author: weeds639
Reviews.Content: Room we had was fairly small, but comfortable for the time we spent in it (nights only) Location of the hotel is fantastic. VERY close to all major sights. However, above all we appreciated the hotel's staff. They were VERY helpful and friendly. This takes in all counter staff on duty while we were there, the outside restaurant manager (Serkan) , and the people tending the breakfast room.Really exceptional, above average! Talking about breakfast, this too was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location 5*, but in need of some facelift”
Reviews.Author: shohman
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed in this hotel from 10-16 Oct with my daughter. This hotel is located next to all the famous attractions - 1 min to Sophia Hagia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi & just under 15 min to Grand Bazaar & Eminoly. So location wise this hotel gets 5* from us, but it's a basic hotel and in need of some upgrading the rooms. The staff are all polite - esp Metin, who spoke better english then others & was very helpful, Cirkan - who was everywhere-front desk, breakfast room (thanks for nice omlettes) & all the others who i did not mention. Ms Tula - Manager of the hotel was very efficient & replyed to my e-mails on time and organised pick up fr airport! all in all good hotel, just minor criticism about selction of fresh fruits available for breakfast - there was not any at all - except grapes...common you can do better, this is a season of pomegranets, pears, apples etc, but unfortunately i did not see any of these on breakfast table. Last, but not least - great WiFi connection in the hotel, daughter was pleased! Best regs

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great staff. Could do with upgrade. No lift!”
Reviews.Author: Ballencrieff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the large suite for a few days. The location cannot be beaten. Literally next to the Ayasofia (Hagia Sophia) and the room had a small balcony terrace looking directly at the Hagia Sophia. Blue Mosque, Basilica Cystern and Topkapi are very very close. If you come to Istanbul and see only one thing make sure you see Topkapi Palace. Truly amazing. The suite in Best Western is a decent size. Queen size bed, lots of space to walk around. The ceiling on top floor is low and many times I bumped my head. The area above the bed has some strange cloth arrangement over it. A nice touch but unnecessary for my taste. Decent size wardrobe for storing your clothes and a safe too. It had an iron already but I had to ask for an ironing board. The TV is small but has hundreds of satellite channels for you in every language you could ever want - English, French, German, Spanish, Russian, Afghan, Iranian, Turkish etc etc. That can be a problem because you have to scroll through hundreds of channels to find the one you want. But BBC is channel 1 which is very useful. The Jacuzzi / Hot Tub is nice and large. And they clean it every day if you are using it. The toiletries provided are decent too. They gave me a shaving kit and Toothbrush kit every day. But maybe this is just for customers in the suite. They didnt replace the shampoo though which was strange. Air con is a problem. It says it has two setting - hot and cold. But when I tried to use it both the settings were blowing hot air. A real problem in the summer, so you have to leave the door open to the terrace. But as the suite was facing the back of the building (towards Ayasofya) this wasnt a big problem. Wifi is a bit slow on the top floor. And sadly the lift was non-functional so you have to carry heavy luggage up and down the stairs. Staff were kind enough to help me on day one, which was very useful and is quite common in Istanbul. A good option to choose if you cannot find something else. I ended up here because everywhere else was booked solid. If you get a chance try the Alemdar restaurant across the road. The food is great there and the staff are good too. One of the waiters is very funny and he speaks many languages. People come to that restaurant just for him. Never tried the breakfast so can't comment on that. Overall it is a decent option. The staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, age is showing, noisy area”
Reviews.Author: dpd0843
Reviews.Content: Picked hotel by location and it was great. We could walk to all important sights in Sultahnamet , and Galata Bridge was only 20 minutes walking. People at hotel very nice although staff would benefit from some additional english . Breakfast in morning very nice and good selection. Room was comfortable but needed some maintenance on ceiling . Air conditioning not functioning one day but they got it repaired. The 5 am wake up call and the tramway have some impact on sleep..good earplugs essential.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Prime location! Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kelley10
Reviews.Content: You need look no further than BW Saint Sophia Hotel to experience the best of Turkish hospitality. As a frequent traveler to Turkey, I have stayed at a number of hotels. However, after two separate stays in May and June 2010, I know that this hotel will be my "home" whenever I am in Istanbul from now on. Our room over the main thoroughfare was spacious and perfect for us. Looking out from the balcony and seeing the Blue Mosque up the street and hearing the frequent call to prayer IS Istanbul for us. The very efficient air conditioner kept us cool and easily blocked out the traffic noise when needed. The bathroom was large and had the hottest water and greatest water pressure that I have ever found in Turkey. The cleaning staff was friendly and always diligent about their work. In fact, every single staff person was outstanding and a real asset to the hotel. All their names escape me, but I remember Fatih was often helping us at the front desk. Airport pickup is a real plus after a long flight. Due to our second stay, I was delievered back to the airport at 3 a.m. for an early, early flight to Amsterdam. How wonderful not to have to worry about such details! Breakfast is something to look forward to because of the great choices--even omelets! Free bottled water was left each day. Hotel manager Tula Bayatis was definitely a major factor in our positive stay. I appreciated her e-mails and the time she took to respond to our questions prior to our arrival. While we were there we had several visits. Tula went out of her way to ensure that our stay was perfect and she succeeded!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quest I
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best i've stayed in. Staff, location were great. Free internet and breakfast was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KarlaSp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western St. Sophia for one night while my parents were here, and the manager bent over backwards to make that affordable for me. My only warning to people who have not been to Turkey before is that all hotels in Sultanahmet and any other areas near mosques are going to have some noise issues-the call to prayer can be an abrupt early-morning wake-up call if you're not used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Mike-of-Oxford
Reviews.Content: We booked via Best Western for a 5 night stay. We were given a very pleasant corner room on the 2nd floor with a view of Saint Sophia on one side and the main road facing the Blue Mosque on the other, which despite a few other reviews saying it was noisy really isn't the case. OK It was fairy cold, so we could close the windows at night, but we didn't have any problems. The staff were very helpful and not at all pushy when we asked for advice. They booked tickets for a performance of the Whirling Dervish without fuss and with no extra charges or commission. We had a small problem with the shower which they made a quick fix the same day, and completely sorted out by the next. The location is just fantastic, you can get to the major sites in minutes, and there are tram stops a few hundred yards up or down the road, so getting to Taksim or the ferry ports for trips further afield is pretty straightforward. They have a small friendly bar attached to the hotel and you can order food from the reasonably priced restaurant just across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ZoraGothenburg
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast. The whole stay was just perfect. You get value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cjlefler
Reviews.Content: There was 4 in our party. We put in a request to have a room facing the Haig Sophia, and Tula granted request. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff was very helpful. They picked us up at the airport and when you have been up for 29 hours that was a great thing. We looked forward to the breakfast every morning, even if they only had instant coffee. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: sking81
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my wife, three teenage children and my in laws. We found this hotel on the internet and chose it based on the responsiveness of the manager Tula's replies to our e-mailed questions before our trip. We were picked up at the airport and brought to the hotel. We were treated like family by Tula and her staff from the moment we arrived and who wanted to ensure my family experienced the best of Istanbul. They succeeded! We stayed at the hotel for six nights and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: stardustvoyager
Reviews.Content: My mother and sister stayed here for a couple of nights in September 2008 as the start to a family holiday in Turkey. I booked it for them a couple of days before arrival due to an unprofessional last-minute cancellation of their booking by their hotel of choice. Here is their review. My mother arrived after a 12-hour overnight flight and says: The hotel was overpriced + noisy, not well maintained, situated on road with major traffic, a rip-off due to central location. Noise of trams passing throughout the night was horrific. We requested to change rooms once we had opened our curtains on arrival and discovered that the windows opened directly onto the noisy outdoor bar. Assistance was not given to us until the next day, hotel staff did offer to move our luggage for us, and once in our new room we found that a bottle of wine was missing from our belongings. Decor needs updating.
